T

TimingController - Class in org.jdesktop.animation.timing
This class is a controls the timing sequence for animations.
TimingController(Cycle, Envelope) - Constructor for class org.jdesktop.animation.timing.TimingController
Constructor: sets up all necessary information
TimingController(Cycle, Envelope, TimingTarget) - Constructor for class org.jdesktop.animation.timing.TimingController
Constructor: sets up all necessary information
TimingController(int, TimingTarget) - Constructor for class org.jdesktop.animation.timing.TimingController
Constructor: this is a utility method that sets up reasonable defaults for a simple timing sequence that will have no delay, will not repeat, will hold the end value when it ends, will use a timer resolution of 10 milliseconds, and will run for the length of time specified in the duration parameter.
timingEvent(long, long, float) - Method in class org.jdesktop.animation.timing.ObjectModifier
Called from TimingController to signal another timing event.
timingEvent(long, long, float) - Method in class org.jdesktop.animation.timing.TimingController
There are two ways to receive timing events: either override this method in a subclass of TimingController or create a TimingController instance directly with a TimingTarget object.
timingEvent(long, long, float) - Method in interface org.jdesktop.animation.timing.TimingTarget
Implementors will override this method and pass the TimingTarget into the TimingController constructor in order to receive timing events.
TimingTarget - Interface in org.jdesktop.animation.timing
This interface provides three methods which are called by TimingController during the course of a timing sequence.
